result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel D. Mannelli

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel D. Mannelli in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

2:06 pm case called. Appearance made. 

Defendant Nathaniel D Mannelli in court. Samuel Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Record made by the State, who needs 2 weeks.
Court goes over right to atty. 
Court responds to defendant's questions as to no contact. 
Record by the state as to no contact. State is not objecting to amending bond to No violent contact., 

Court amends bond to No Violent Contact.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 10/20/2022 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT with H.R.M. or RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.**


Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH H.R.M. or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4811 & 4812
